1.text: And Zophar the Naamathite will answer and say,

2.text: Shall not the multitude of words be answered? and shall a man of lips be justified?

3.text: Shall thy empty talks cause men to be silent? and wilt thou deride and none making ashamed?

4.text: And thou wilt say, My instruction is pure, and I was clean in thine eyes.

5.text: And who Will give God speaking, and he will open his lips with thee?

6.text: And he shall announce to thee hidden things of wisdom, for they are the double for understanding. And know thou that God will set to thee from thine iniquity.

7.text: Searching shalt thou and God? Shalt thou find the Almighty even to completeness?

8.text: The heavens being high, what wilt thou do? Hades being deep, what wilt thou know?

9.text: Its measure long above the earth, and broad above the sea.

10.text: If he shall pass on, and shut up, and gather together, who shall turn him back.

11.text: For he knew men of vanity, and he will see iniquity; and will he not understand?

12.text: And man being empty will be without heart: and man will be born a wild assâ€™s colt.

13.text: If thou preparedst thy heart, and didst spread thy hands towards him;

14.text: If iniquity in thy hand, remove it far off, and wickedness shall not dwell in thy tents.

15.text: For then thou shalt lift up thy face from spot; and thou wert firm, and thou shalt not fear:

16.text: For thou shalt forget toil, then shalt remember as waters they passed away.

17.text: And life shall rise above the noonday: thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.

18.text: And thou didst trust, for there is hope; and thou didst search out; thou shalt lie down confidently.

19.text: And thou shalt lie down and none terrifying; and many waited for thy face.

20.text: And the eyes of the unjust shall be consumed, and flight shall perish from them, and their hope a breathing out of the soul.
